titles.title: Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness Act of 2009
A bill to provide for the adjustment of status of certain nationals of Liberia to that of lawful permanent residents.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary:
3/19/2009--Introduced. Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness Act of 2009 - Adjusts to permanent resident status a qualifying Liberian national who: (1) has been continuously present in the United States from January 1, 2009, through the date of status adjustment application; or (2) is the spouse, child, or unmarried son or daughter of such an alien.
Requires adjustment applications to be filed before April 1, 2011.
